page.title: 07KINGSTON VILLAGE
page.content: Just off the B2065 lies the village of Kingston. It is not on a major traffic route and the majority of houses are built on both sides of a quiet road, without pavements, rising gently away from the valley towards Marley. A second lane leads past the church, several more houses and the post office-cum-shop, which provides the usual postal services, provisions and newspapers. Although parts of the church are Saxon, there are very few old properties, only two are listed buildings. Some houses are pre-1940 but most have been built in the past 30 years and are well maintained with attractive gardens. The population has steadily increased and at present in the immediate village, it numbers approx. 340, of which 76 are children and of the adults, 50 are retired.
